actions.description: Typically 25% of a person’s footprint comes from travel...
actions.reference: Mike Berners-Lee, Richmond gov, Lund University

actions.action: Walk more instead of driving short journeys
actions.description: Walking has so many benefits compared to driving a car; less air pollution and emissions...

actions.action: Take the train or bus instead of driving
actions.description: Travelling by train can reduce your emissions by 70-80% compared to driving.

well_done_comments: Well done for using electric vehicle charging!
recommendations: Eating less meat can be a quick and easy way to reduce your overall emissions.
Opt for air drying! It's as vital as choosing the right wash temperature, promoting both clothing longevity and a lower environmental footprint.
Just reducing your red meat consumption can have a significant impact. The carbon impact of chicken is 8 times lower than the carbon impact of beef, on average, per gram of protein.
equivalents: This is equivalent to the emissions from flying a light private jet for 0.7 hours.
This is equivalent to the emissions from providing 0.6 UK homes with gas for a year.
This is equivalent to the emissions from flying from London to New York 1 times.
